title: Accardo
author: Accardo
content: Below is a poll of confidence between Bitcoin and USD conducted yesterday, and surprisingly many voters roots for US dollar. The 97.11% seem to be people who never trusted Bitcoin to exceed their expectation and instead of accepting how huge the potentials of BTC is in the present and future, they'll rather console themselves with the conclusion that btc won't reach greater heights on the long term. https://www.smerconish.com/daily-poll/ source

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: I don't even know there was this kind of survey.Anyway, I found something interesting from the past poll results. At least we know who're the majority of people behind the voters. I'm curious what if the poll ask about gold and USD or S&P 500 and USD, if they're still votes for USD, it's not surprising why most people are poor and most banks are still survive.

comments.author: Moreno233
comments.body: Quote from: Accardo on November 26, 2024, 08:14:07 AMBelow is a poll of confidence between Bitcoin and USD conducted yesterday, and surprisingly many voters roots for US dollar. The 97.11% seem to be people who never trusted Bitcoin to exceed their expectation and instead of accepting how huge the potentials of BTC is in the present and future, they'll rather console themselves with the conclusion that btc won't reach greater heights on the long term. https://www.smerconish.com/daily-poll/ sourceI'm actually surprised seeing this poll as it gets to show that not many people are taking their finances seriously. Bitcoin have been on the news for a while now and was among the focal point in the electioneering campaign of the president elect Donald Trump, so I don't know if the people listening to him have been able to spend few minutes into researching about Bitcoin as people who are interested in making the future better. Like I said before, I expected the numbers to be higher in favor of Bitcoin. From the Reddit post, the author was excited that we are early to Bitcoin and I agree with that because I can only imagine when the percentage will get to 50% in favor of Bitcoin , we would have been talking about Bitcoin price at over $500k. Therefore, I feel we are still very early to Bitcoin, the reason we should still persevere in buying and holding.

comments.author: retreat
comments.body: Most people today would probably trust USD more than Bitcoin for the reason that USD is usually a currency backed by the US economy, its value tends to be stable, while Bitcoin has volatility and it is not freely used in daily transactions, and other reasons. However, this wrong view is what makes more and more people lose the opportunity to invest in Bitcoin at a better price, they do not think clearly and turn a blind eye to the fact that Bitcoin's value continues to increase and its adoption is increasingly widespread.

comments.author: Smack That Ace
comments.body: Not surprised by this result or any poll on bitcoin vs gold, bitcoin vs stocks...i believe it will have similar results. We need to be realistic that no matter how good bitcoin is, no matter how much potential it has, it is still an asset class that is only 15 years old and has not been recognized worldwide, many people do not even care about its existence. Meanwhile, the remaining assets are thousands of years old, hundreds of years old and recognized by the whole world. So it is understandable why bitcoin is not the choice of most people. According to a survey, less than 10% of the world's population invests in bitcoin, what can we expect? Everything takes time and bitcoin is no exception.

Because the majority here are all bitcoin investors and users, and there is no way we shoot ourselves on the foot by voting for fiat /watching fiat do better than our very own bitcoin.So, in conclusion, I don't trust the platform where the vote/poll was held to have enough or the same number of those who reallly understand bitcoin as much as they understood USD, else, the result would have been more competitive than this, it's clear that those who voted in that poll really do not know what bitcoin is or all about.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Accardo on November 26, 2024, 08:14:07 AMBelow is a poll of confidence between Bitcoin and USD conducted yesterday, and surprisingly many voters roots for US dollar. The 97.11% seem to be people who never trusted Bitcoin to exceed their expectation and instead of accepting how huge the potentials of BTC is in the present and future, they'll rather console themselves with the conclusion that btc won't reach greater heights on the long term. There is a need to consider who the respondents of the survey are and how were they selected. If the respondents were drawn from a population that has little or no knowledge about Bitcoin, the result would favor fiat. An average citizen in my country doesn't know much about Bitcoin but everyone knows that the dollar is a valuable currency. If you ask people in a crypto forum or social media platform this question, I know that the majority of them will accept that they have confidence in Bitcoin more than the dollar.
